Posts.Title: If you are not Stage IV but have questions, you may post here chrissyb Olma61

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2015 11:21AM funthing42 wrote: You have to remember that everyone's breast ca is so different. If you look at my Hx a year ago today I had a b/l mastectomy . For me because of recurrence it was thought to be the best thing . 2 mos after chemo it came back in the skin locally. My only regret is not getting a second opinion in 2009. I would have removed them the first time. My lesion was 0.6mm. But aggressive. No nodes. I would have not had Rads the first time. I guess that is three regrets. And then for the forth . When my breast Ca recurred the second time I would have kept them. It's awful either way. And very much like the weather . But just make sure you do not rush into anything. Get your second and third opinions . Good luck !!! Read survivor stories best way combat free. I'm still one step ahead . Pets negative. No nodes off to have rads again. This time second and third opinions from the top 5. MAKE sure get your report. Do not let insurance dictate your future. Contact American Cancer institute know your rights. Then go on one of theses forums for insurance issue and post away. Good luck :) Big hugs.

What I have had the most regret is not following my instincts. Which become heighten when our bodies have disease. Do not let doctors drag their feet or pat you on the back. If you do not get what you want go elsewhere quick. I was extremely trusting even when my body told me something else.

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2018 08:05AM - edited Dec 16, 2018 08:06AM by funthing42 DVA I had a reoccurrence less than a month off of herceptin. It went to my skin. My battle is fruitless. They told me I was Her 2 + then they said I was Her 2-. Im sorry to hear this. I'm waiting for xeloda to work. Do Genetic dna testing if you haven't already. I seemed to be resistant to everthing no remission just progression. Hang in there. Never dreamed of this and no one every really goes there to elaborate or think outside the standardized care.

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2018 12:06AM - edited Nov 8, 2018 12:21AM by funthing42 Hi everyone, Im newly diagnosed with liver mets. Im starting Xeloda only. I did Ibrance and fasolodex. Received 2yrs of thought to be piece of mind.(always get imaging) Scout about I have a question. What treatments have you had. I like the way your onc is changing it up. I often wonder if meds we have used in the past can be used for future treatments. Or basically trying to trick cancer by switching meds say Ibrance stopped working so bring it back later after a other treatment fails. I dont know grasping at straws . I guess. Im not sure if I should worry about receiving only one med and no iv chemo . I really haven't responded well to treatments thus far. Im not sure if I should ask for the strongest now or wait? Hard decision to make. Thanks for listening:(

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2018 08:42PM - edited Nov 8, 2018 08:42PM by funthing42 Wow this is definitely the positive energy I needed. Way to kick CA. Thanks for the useful information. I need to start thinking of it as a disease not Cancer. I was feeling low and disappointed. Granax I was on Fasoldex and Ibrance 2yrs. My other mets is in my lymph node the opposite side of my orginal dx. I had skin mets but gone now , very happy about that. :) radiation. Tomorrow Im going for Thoracic and brain MRI"s. Ugh. Big hugs to all. Im Thinking of something strange. My grandmother had Cancer. I remember my parents driving her to treatments. They used a hyperbaric chamber she was so afraid. :( Why do we not here of this anymore? I also thought of blood transfusions. Im sure this would not work. Im now eating like a rabbit. No meat, no sugar, no flour, and no wine :( lol. Just random thoughts ...... :)
